I donâ€™t understand if youÂ registered it 6 yrs ago then it is registered you just need toÂ goÂ online with the numbers and get a copy rhe trailer you go to a justice of the peace and swear how you got it then you can Licence or you take it to an inspection place for trailers and then Licence it as if you made it

I have a pleasure craft licence with the boats # but the document clearly stated â€œThis is not a Titleâ€.I do have a trailer license so I assume now that I have that ownership in my wallet or boat, checking now, man I feel dumb...

No one ever asks for a title. Â They want the registered numbers and papers Â it should have your name on it the only thing peopleÂ in Canada get close to a title is the bill of sale. Â I had toÂ send them a copy of the bill of sale when I registered my boat

Thank for reply, Iâ€™m going to head to mto Monday (bring a book) and 100% get everything documented. I know probably faster online but In person I will not screw it up. I obviously have trailer papers somewhere since I have the plate. If selling a boat does the trailer plate stay with trailer or put on new trailer? Yes, I am slow but I really appreciate the forums patience. ğŸ˜
The plate and the plate part of the ownership stays with you

All I have for my boat is a Bill of Sale and registration paper. The home built trailer needed to be weighed. I went to the local farmers mill and had it weighed but any weigh station will do. Took the weight slip to Service Ontario and they made an ownership for the trailer and sold me the license plate. It was pretty simple really to get everything done.
If you already have the trailer plated, you can get another copy of the ownership at the MTO.
